NAME: FLAME MEPHIT
Trace 1: You notice an impetuous slogan burnt into the wall here.
Trace 2: You hear a small explosion far away and the faint chorus of hysterical laughter.
Tracks: A trail of burnt objects and charred stones lead deeper into the dungeon.
Spoor: Everything is burning in this room! You can still hear mischievous cackling just beyond.
Omen: A random piece of clothing spontaneously catches on fire and you can see a growing glow from around the corner.
Encounter: 1D8 hysterical little fire jesters burst from every nook and cranny.
variation 1: FIRE MEPHITS serving a powerful elemental
variation 2: FIRE MEPHITS running an arena
variation 6: FIRE MEPHITS rumored to serve a WIZARD

NAME: ARCTIC BAT
Trace 1: You notice a single sleeping arctic bat on the ceiling.
Trace 2: You find the frozen body of an animal from the area covered in tiny bite marks.
Tracks: You hear the distinctive screeches of bats from further inside the dungeon.
Omen: It suddenly starts snowing as a cacophony of bat screeches is getting closer.
Encounter: You are swarmed by dozens of screeching snowflakes (2 swarms of arctic bats). The noise makes it hard to communicate.
variation 1: ravenous swarms of ARCTIC BATS hiding in blizzards
variation 2: ARCTIC BATS whose freezing venom is covered by assassins
variation 4: swarms of ARCTIC BATS during winter
variation 5: ARCTIC BATS whose fur is worth a lot in the South
variation 6: ARCTIC BATS that can make unwary travelers die of hypothermia

NAME: AIR ELEMENTAL
Trace 1: A brisk wind messes your hair.
Trace 2: The find the weather unnaturally windy.
Tracks: A trail of randomly scattered things lead deeper into the dungeon.
Spoor: This room is a huge mess as if a hurricane had been through. You can hear howling winds in the next room.
Omen: The overwhelming sound of howling winds envelop you and is only getting louder and louder.
Encounter: Whirls of dust in the air coalesce in a vague humanoid shape.
variation 1: metal-hating AIR ELEMENTALS
variation 2: AIR ELEMENTALS protecting the sky
variation 5: AIR ELEMENTALS slowly eroding the earth
variation 6: AIR ELEMENTALS longing to go return to their plane

NAME: MUD MEPHIT
Trace 1: You notice a pitiful plea written in mud on the wall here.
Trace 2: There is dried mud in incongruous places here.
Tracks: Sinuous trails of mud lead deeper into the dungeon.
Spoor: There is a giant pile of wet mud in the middle of this room. It is still fresh.
Omen: You hear wet footsteps getting closer.
Encounter: Please! Oh no! You hear as 1D8 small muddy creatures seep out of the cracks around you.
variation 1: MUD MEPHITS serving a powerful elemental
variation 2: MUD MEPHITS running a bathhouse
variation 6: MUD MEPHITS rumored to serve a WIZARD

NAME: GRIFFON
Trace 1: Heraldic symbols on banners or stones depicting a griffon.
Trace 2: Dried bones with signs of shock damage.
Tracks: Big quadrupedal birds circling above something further along the path.
Spoor: A half-eaten carcass nudged somewhere inaccessible from the ground.
Omen: A piercing eagle cry from straight above you.
Encounter: 1D4 big griffons are circling around you menacingly.
variation 1: GRIFFONS from the Royal Aviary
variation 2: man-eating GRIFFONS
variation 6: spotted GRIFFONS

NAME: OWLBEAR
Trace 1: You notice large claw marks under the dirt on the floor.
Trace 2: You hear an owl hooting in the distance.
Tracks: There are big muddy bear tracks leading further along the path.
Spoor: The bloody bones of a bear are scattered around. It was eaten by something bigger.
Omen: You hear an owl's hoot. But it's way too close and way too loud.
variation 1: big OWLBEARS
variation 2: nocturnal OWLBEARS
variation 6: OWLBEARS that are sacred to the locals

NAME: GRAVEL MEPHIT
Trace 1: Somebody has written "Do Not Touch" with pebbles.
Trace 2: A piece of furniture is buried under a pile of earth.
Tracks: A trail of pebbles lead deeper into the dungeon.
Spoor: A fresh pile of earth blocks one of the exits of this room.
Omen: You can hear the noise of gravel being dumped in the next room.
Encounter: 1D8 tiny stone mouths sprout from a nearby pile of rocks: "Please stop what you are doing!"
variation 1: GRAVEL MEPHITS serving a powerful elemental
variation 2: GRAVEL MEPHITS tending to an ancient monument
variation 3: GRAVEL MEPHITS who want to bury the world
variation 4: GRAVEL MEPHIT merchants who only buy and never sell
variation 6: GRAVEL MEPHITS rumored to serve a WIZARD

NAME: BOLTFORAGER
Trace 1: A chorus of raspy bird noises overwhelms all other sounds as the sun sets or rises.
Trace 2: You notice the dead body of a local vermin is infested with orange worms.
Tracks: You can hear scavenger birds bicker over a carcass further down the path.
Spoor: You recoil as you discover the still-twitching body of an obviously sick animal.
Omen: You duck as a big orange bird swoops past you leaving a stinky trail of ochre dust behind.
Encounter: 2D6 big dirty birds observe you. Their big beaks are topped by bony ridges from which hangs torn pieces of rotten flesh.
variation 1: ORANGE BIRDS that carry deadly parasites
variation 2: flocks of strange CARRION BIRDS that come out at dawn
variation 3: flocks of strange CARRION BIRDS that come out at dusk
variation 6: dangerous ORANGE BIRDS that are sacred to the locals

NAME: KONGAMATO
Trace 1: You notice the debris of a broken rotting boat.
Trace 2: Dark-red clusters of mushroom seem to grow from bat guano here. They are infected with Eye Rot disease.
Tracks: The bitter smell of guano and wet dogs seems coming from deeper along the path.
Spoor: A capsized rowboat floats to the surface of a nearby river.
Omen: You jump at the sudden song of something diving in the water nearby.
Encounter: I giant bat grazes you as it swoops from above.
variation 1: GIANT RIVER BATS that carry the Eye Rot disease
variation 2: GIANT BATS that harass fishermen in the river there
variation 6: the feared KONGAMATO BATS guarding the sacred river running through the land

NAME: WIZARD
Trace 1: You notice a broken fragment of a crystal vial.
Trace 2: You find a loose page of what must have been a treatise on arcane magic. Half the text is unreadable.
Tracks: There's energy in the air. You can feel magic has been cast here recently.
Spoor: One of the creatures of this dungeon lies incapacitated by magic.
Omen: You hear a voice chanting the words of an arcane incantation nearby!
Encounter: A wizard and its assistant appear in a puff of smoke.
variation 1: a WIZARD looking for rare ingredients
variation 2: a WIZARD studying the monstrous ecosystem of the land
variation 3: a WIZARD that has moved here to avoid disturbances
variation 4: a WIZARD on an archeological expedition
variation 5: WIZARDS building a portal to rdmPLANE
variation 6: a scheming WIZARD

NAME: WAR WIZARD
variation 1: a ROYAL WAR WIZARD garrison
variation 2: a WAR WIZARD batallion hunting rebels
variation 4: a legion of WAR WIZARDS pacifying the land
variation 5: WAR WIZARDS overseeing the construction of a fortress
variation 6: two WAR WIZARD factions battling each other

NAME: HIGH MAGE
variation 1: the council of HIGH MAGES
variation 2: ELVEN HIGH MAGES observing the cosmos
variation 6: philosophizing HIGH MAGES

NAME: SPELLJAMMER CAPTAIN
variation 1: merchant SPELLJAMMER SHIPS
variation 2: armed SPELLJAMMER SHIPS
variation 6: massive SPELLJAMMER SHIPS

NAME: BOAR
Trace 1: Upturned earth reveals clusters of chewed roots here.
Trace 2: The vegetation has recently been flattened here.
Tracks: Muddy cloven hoof tracks lead further along the path.
Spoor: A hole has recently been dug up here.
Omen: Sniffing and chewing noises are getting closer!
Encounter: 1D6 boars (or 1D4 giant boars) squeal as the curiously approach you.
variation 1: stubborn rdmSIZE BOARS
variation 2: DIRTY rdmSIZE BOARS
variation 3: rdmSIZE BOARS that will eat anything
variation 5: rdmSIZE BOARS that can smell rare mushrooms
variation 6: rdmSIZE BOARS that are sacred to the locals

NAME: EARTH ELEMENTAL
Trace 1: Jagged rocks piercing the ground attract your attention.
Trace 2: The earth shakes for a few seconds.
Tracks: Many things are oddly half-sunken into the ground along the path forward.
Spoor: The area has recently been completely flattened by something heavy.
Omen: A huge rock crashes a few feet in front of you.
Encounter: A mound of earth with vaguely humanoid features walks towards you with heavy steps.
variation 1: EARTH ELEMENTALS building a new mountain
variation 2: EARTH ELEMENTALS that want to redirect the wind elsewhere
variation 3: EARTH ELEMENTALS filling a crater with dirt
variation 4: EARTH ELEMENTALS filling all water sources with dirt
variation 5: EARTH ELEMENTALS protecting a mysterious cave
variation 6: EARTH ELEMENTALS longing to go return to their plane

NAME: BASILISK
Trace 1: You notice the petrified body of a cowering rat.
Trace 2: What you thought was a statue seems far too uncanny to be the work of a sculptor.
Tracks: The tracks of two big lizards walking in file lead deeper into the dungeon.
Spoor: A broken statue in this room seems to be bleeding.
Omen: You have the uncanny feeling of being observed. Your body is starting to feel numb.
Encounter: A giant lizard with eight legs crawls towards where you are.
variation 1: deadly BASILISKS
variation 2: BASILISKS nesting in the driest spots
variation 3: BASILISKS said to gaze into the PLANE OF EARTH
variation 4: a GIANT BASILISK worshipped by the locals
variation 6: BASILISKS that are sacred to the locals

NAME: BAT
Trace 1: You notice a single sleeping bat on the ceiling.
Trace 2: Some objects in the area are soiled by bat guano.
Tracks: You hear the distinctive screeches of bats from further inside the dungeon.
Omen: A cacophony of bat screeches is getting closer.
Encounter: You are swarmed by dozens of screeching snowflakes (2 swarms of arctic bats). The noise makes it hard to communicate.
variation 1: nocturnal BATS
variation 2: vampiric BATS
variation 6: BATS that are sacred to the locals

NAME: GIANT TRESSYM
Trace 1: You hear a feline roar far and high above you.
Trace 2: You notice a ball of hair and feathers.
Tracks: Big feline tracks lead further ahead before disappearing completely.
Spoor: A freshly killed animal carcass is hanging from a hard-to-reach place.
Omen: You hear a feline roar from above you. It is too close for comfort.
Encounter: A giant winged cat taunts you from above.
variation 1: wise WINGED PANTHERS
variation 2: GREATER WINGED CATS known as Tressyms
variation 4: feline GIANT TRESSYMS who speak in riddles
variation 5: GOLDEN WINGED PUMAS known as Jana-Nimr
variation 6: GIANT WINGED CATS that are worshiped by the locals

NAME: STEAM ELEMENTAL
Trace 1: Hot steam seem to escape from cracks in the floor here.
Tracks: A trail of dew leads deeper into the dungeon.
Spoor: A whimpering creature is dying in the corner. It seems to have been boiled alive.
Omen: The air becomes heavy and humid. The temperature rises and droplets appear everywhere.
Encounter: A jet of steam takes a vaguely humanoid shape and hisses at you.
variation 1: STEAM ELEMENTALS building a wall of fog around the area
variation 2: STEAM ELEMENTALS protecting a sacred hot spring
variation 3: STEAM ELEMENTALS blocking the sky with rain clouds
variation 4: STEAM ELEMENTALS attacking anybody starting a fire
variation 6: STEAM ELEMENTALS longing to go return to their plane

NAME: HAWK
Trace 1: You hear the distinct sound of a faraway hawk.
Tracks: There's a tiny dot far ahead in the sky. It must be a bird.
Spoor: A small rodent falls from the sky. It is dead.
Omen: You are startled by the distinctive screech of an hawk.
Encounter: You instinctively duck as an hawk swoops passed you.
variation 1: rdmSIZE HAWKS that are prized by military officers
variation 2: rdmSIZE HAWKS that are easily domesticated
variation 6: rdmSIZE HAWKS that are sacred for the locals
